alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 9:08PM PDT until May 26 at 2:03AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Spring snowmelt and rain from showers and thunderstorms will produce increased high flows on the Stehekin and Kettle Rivers. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 19.1 feet Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 05/20/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Cold and swift flowing rivers can be life threatening this time of year. The combination of cold water shock and fast current increases the danger of drowning in our rivers. Keep an eye on children if they are playing near rivers and put a life jacket on them. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 315 PM PDT.
